english_translation: Narrated by Jabir ibn Zayd: It reached me that Umar ibn al-Khattab (may Allah be pleased with him) went out with the Messenger of Allah ﷺ on one of his journeys. Umar asked the Messenger of Allah ﷺ about something, and the Messenger of Allah ﷺ did not answer him. Then he asked him three times, and the Messenger of Allah ﷺ did not answer him. Umar said to himself: Woe to you, O Umar, you have bothered the Messenger of Allah ﷺ three times and all that he does not answer you. Umar said: I moved my camel forward ahead of the people and feared that a revelation might come down regarding me. As I traveled, I heard a crier calling out, so I hurried until I came to the Messenger of Allah ﷺ and greeted him. He said: A chapter has been revealed to me which is dearer to me than everything upon which the sun rises. Then he recited: Indeed, We have given you a clear victory.
